content.rendered:
We Represent Victims Injured In Fire Accidents

Fires rarely happen by accident. In most cases, the fire or the resulting injuries were caused by negligence.

Common Causes Of Fires

Examples of property negligence include:

  • Missing or nonfunctioning smoke alarms
  • Missing or nonfunctioning fire extinguishers
  • Improper wiring
  • Improper ingress and egress
  • Improper storage of flammable materials
  • Natural gas leaks

When property owners, electricians, contractors, natural gas suppliers or others put people in danger, they need to be held accountable for the consequences.

We Will Fight To Get What You Deserve

At Lamkin, Van Eman, Trimble & Dougherty, LLC, our law firm has a 50-year tradition of representing those injured in fires and other accidents in Columbus and throughout Ohio. If our lawyers feel that the property owner or another party was negligent, we will spend the time and resources it takes to obtain the compensation you deserve.

Call To Meet With An Experienced Injury Attorney Today

We invite you to schedule an appointment with a lawyer from our team to talk about your accident and how we can help you recover from the responsible party.

Call 614-360-2706 today or contact us online. We offer free consultations and contingency fee arrangements.
